intro: Diascia macowanii, commonly known as the common diascia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Diascia macowanii is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
